SEARCH
Package com.example.atlasevents

Class Session

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.Session
public class Session extends Object
Handles user session management within the Atlas Events application.

This class provides methods to store, retrieve, and remove user login information using SharedPreferences. It maintains the logged-in user's email address to persist session data between app launches.

It also offers functionality to log out the user and redirect them to the SignInActivity, ensuring proper session cleanup.

See Also:
  • SharedPreferences
  • SignInActivity

  • Constructor Details

    • Session

      public Session(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new Session instance using the provided application context.

      Initializes the shared preferences and its editor to enable persistent storage of user session data.

      Parameters:
      context - the context used to access shared preferences

  • Method Details

    • setUserEmail

      public void setUserEmail(String email)
      Stores the user's email in shared preferences.

      This method is typically called upon successful authentication to mark the user as logged in.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the logged-in user

    • getUserEmail

      public String getUserEmail()
      Retrieves the currently logged-in user's email.
      Returns:
      the email address of the logged-in user, or null if no user is logged in

    • isLoggedIn

      public boolean isLoggedIn()
      Checks if a user is currently logged in.

      Determines login status based on the presence of a stored email in shared preferences.

      Returns:
      true if a user is logged in; false otherwise

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user.

      Removes the stored email from shared preferences to clear session data, effectively ending the user's session.

    • logoutAndRedirect

      public void logoutAndRedirect(android.app.Activity activity)
      Logs out the current user and redirects them to the SignInActivity.

      This method clears the session, launches the sign-in screen as a new task, and finishes the current activity to prevent the user from navigating back.

      Parameters:
      activity - the current activity context used for redirection
